text: Sitting in a chair for too long can cause fatigue and soreness, so many people choose to lie down and stretch out on something soft. What object in a room is most suitable for this?

After sitting for an extended period, most people experience fatigue and soreness, and prefer lying down and stretching out on something soft. What object in a room could be most suitable for this purpose?
A comfortable piece of furniture in a room where one can lay down and stretch to relieve soreness and fatigue from extended periods of sitting.
After sitting in a chair for too long, many people may find it beneficial to lay down and rest on a soft object. What in the room would be the most suitable object to use for this purpose?

When sitting in a chair for extended periods, it's common to feel fatigued and sore, motivating many people to instead lie down on something soft to stretch out. Please suggest what furniture object inside a room would be most appropriate for this.
If someone wishes to lie down and stretch out on something soft instead of sitting in a chair for an extended period, what object in a room is typically best suited for this purpose?
